content.body: There was an interesting discussion in the last TC39/JavaScript Tools meeting about how pipeline was more statically analyzable by bundlers as a means of inlining and optimizing. I do wonder about the statements from implementers that F#-style couldn't be optimized. I definitely believe that F#+PFA could have been optimized to reduce actual function allocations. i.e., `x |> f~(?)` would have had no more overhead than `x |> f(%)`.
content.formatted_body: There was an interesting discussion in the last TC39/JavaScript Tools meeting about how pipeline was more statically analyzable by bundlers as a means of inlining and optimizing. I do wonder about the statements from implementers that F#-style couldn't be optimized. I definitely believe that F#+PFA could have been optimized to reduce actual function allocations. i.e., x |> f~(?) would have had no more overhead than x |> f(%).
